description: Implied warranty of habitability in new home
facts: Quinn bought a newly constructed home from Rachel Builders
Within 6 months, the foundation developed major cracks
The electrical system was improperly installed and poses fire hazard
Rachel claims the sale was 'as-is' though no such clause was in the contract
asp_facts: property_sale(ps1). buyer(ps1, quinn). seller(ps1, rachel_builders). property_type(ps1, new_construction). time_since_purchase_months(ps1, 6). foundation_defects(ps1, yes). electrical_defects(ps1, yes). safety_hazard(ps1, yes). as_is_clause(ps1, no). contract_type(ps1, new_home_sale).
question: Can Quinn recover against Rachel Builders for the defects?
rationale: The implied warranty of habitability applies to new home construction and cannot be easily disclaimed. Rachel Builders is liable for latent defects affecting the home's habitability and safety.
